channel.title: Client model help
channel.description: I've been messing around with the ints for the vesta spear because it's not going in to my hand, it just goes under it, here's what I mean [IMG]http://i707.photobucket.com/albums/ww76/Jakesta96/glitch3.jpg[/img] I've raised the up/down int by 150 and it still hasn't moved up. What do I do?

item.title: Client model help
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:6, topic:293755”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=388668.msg2906562#msg2906562 date=1249839974]

re-animate it? NO WAY!

animating a sword manually is so simple.
all you gotta do is get the anim data from a different sword, and apply it to your new 1
[/quote]

Or just apply right hand animation?[/quote]

that glitches things sometimes, its not 100% accurate.

Read full topic

item.title: Client model help
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

rip4d:

You have to place it in the right position in Metasequoia, the ints only change color and the view in your inventory.

what rip is trying to say (if you dont understand) is that the model itself is lowered out of your hand.
Since vesta’s or any other weaponry type model 500+ is based off the new jagex avatar design, their arms are a bit different and longer, therefore, the model will be lower than a 317 sword, you have to open this model with meta and move it up a little.

Don’t forget you’ll have to re animate it.

Read full topic

item.description:
